title: Password Strength Analyzer
summary: Built a simple tool to evaluate password strength based on common security rules and best practices.
description: Developed a password strength analyzer that checks user input against basic security criteria such as length, character variety, and common weakness patterns. The goal was to understand why weak passwords are dangerous and how basic validation can improve security awareness.
problem: Many users create weak passwords without understanding what makes a password insecure. Applications often rely on minimal validation, leading to easily guessable or reusable passwords.
approach: Researched common password weaknesses and attack patterns
Defined simple strength rules (length, uppercase, lowercase, numbers, symbols)
Implemented logic to score passwords based on these rules
Provided clear feedback explaining why a password is weak or strong
Tested the analyzer with common weak password examples
outcome: Created a functional password strength checker that helps demonstrate basic security principles and encourages stronger password creation.
highlights: Clear user feedback on password weaknesses
Security-focused thinking applied to a simple tool
notes: This is a beginner security project focused on fundamentals rather than advanced cryptography or real-world password cracking.
